alert.note: Alert for Mendocino Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 07 at 1:23PM PST until March 08 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following area, Mendocino Coast. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain is expected late Thursday into Friday. Snow melt may contribute a small amount to this as well. This may cause flooding in some areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
